error.signature: 502 ERROR The request could not be satisfied. CloudFront wasn't able to connect to the origin
error.regex: (502 ERROR|CloudFront wasn't able to connect to the origin|OriginUnreachable)

verdict.summary: CloudFront cannot reach the configured origin server due to DNS, security group, or SSL/TLS issues.

dead_ends.action: Invalidate CloudFront cache to fix origin errors
dead_ends.why_fails: Cache invalidation does not fix connectivity issues between CloudFront and the origin

dead_ends.action: Change CloudFront price class to fix the issue
dead_ends.why_fails: Price class only affects which edge locations are used, not origin connectivity

workarounds.action: Verify origin domain name resolves and origin server is accessible
workarounds.how: Check DNS resolution, verify security groups allow CloudFront IPs, ensure origin is healthy

workarounds.action: Match SSL/TLS protocol between CloudFront and origin
workarounds.how: Set Origin Protocol Policy to HTTPS Only and ensure origin supports TLSv1.2

leads_to.condition: Origin down triggers Route53 health check failures

frequently_confused_with.distinction: WAF blocks return 403 Forbidden; origin errors return 502/504 when CloudFront cannot reach the backend
